program_title: Denali Commission High Energy Cost Grants
program_description: Through this program, USDA Rural Development partners with the Denali Commission to lower energy costs for people in remote Alaska communities.
application_process_note: Applicants apply for funding through the Denali Commission, not USDA Rural Development.
who_can_apply_primary: Only the Denali Commission can apply for this grant.
who_can_apply_pass_through_note: Pass-through funds from the grant are available to eligible organizations listed below.
eligible_organizations_2: State, local, and Tribal governments and their affiliated organizations
how_to_get_started_contact: Contact the Denali Commission to apply.
who_can_answer_questions_contact: You can contact the USDA Rural Development Rural Utilities Service Electric Programs staff for help.
how_can_funds_be_used_purpose: Funds can be used to offset the high cost of energy generation, transmission and distribution.
governing_program_1_name: The Rural Electrification Act of 1936, as amended through P.L. 118-22, enacted November 17, 2023
qr_code_description: Denali Commission High Energy Cost Grants
note_disclaimer: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_usda_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
